definitions.definition: walk with long, decisive steps in a specified direction.
synonyms: step "she came striding down the path"

definitions.definition: walk about or along (a street or other place) with long, decisive steps.
examples: a woman striding the cobbled streets

definitions.definition: cross (an obstacle) with one long step.
examples: by giving a little leap she could stride across like a grown-up
new wealth enabled Britain to stride the world once more
he crossed the room in a couple of strides

definitions.definition: the length of a step or manner of taking steps in walking or running.
a step or stage in progress toward an aim.
examples: great strides have been made toward equality

definitions.definition: a good or regular rate of progress, especially after a slow or hesitant start.
examples: noun: one's stride; plural noun: one's strides

definitions.definition: denoting or relating to a rhythmic style of jazz piano playing in which the left hand alternately plays single bass notes on the downbeat and chords an octave higher on the upbeat.
